name: Chris Hahn IO
tagline: Trust me, this is easier than talking to me in person
body:
## Development Sandbox
Look at this code snippet. It's all stylized and stuff. You can ignore the substance. God bless america.

```
$ cd your_repo_root/repo_name
$ git fetch origin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

I left that markup there as a reference. This is where my stuff actually starts:

#### Javascript Landscape Generator
I found this article on using maths to generate landscapes randomly using native JS, and loved it. I'm a big fan of computer-generated art (see: pixel art generator) so this is right up my alley.

Original Article - http://www.playfuljs.com/realistic-terrain-in-130-lines/

My copy - http://chrishahn.github.io/landscape
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
